description: From Old French desagraable (compare French désagréable). Surface etymology is dis- +‎ agreeable.

adjectives.description: disagreeable (comparative more disagreeable, superlative most disagreeable)

entries.meaning: Causing repugnance; unpleasant to the feelings or senses; displeasing.
(archaic) Not suitable; that does not conform or fit.
Something or someone displeasing; anything that is disagreeable.
examples: The disagreeables of travelling are necessary evils, to be encountered for the sake of the agreeables of resting and looking round you.
